paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Macrotomoderus niger
Uhmann, 1993
: 396
(not
Macrotomoderus niger
Pic, 1943 c
: 11
)

subSubSection.paragraph: Notes

Pic ( 1943 c)
described
Macrotomoderus niger
from "Born√©o" (without further data), while
Uhmann ( 1993 : 396 )
later described another
M . niger
from Kinabalu National Park (Borneo, Malaysia ). Both species are known only from the original descriptions. This Pic species and
Macrotomoderus minor Pic, 1934
from Vietnam (
Pic 1934 b: 28
) were overlooked and not included in the identification key of this genus (
Uhmann 1993
). The replacement name
Macrotomoderus ater
nom. nov. is here proposed for
M. niger Uhmann
, and is based on the Latin word for black ("
ater
").
Notes

Telnov ( 2007 b)
synonymised
Derarimus
Bonadona, 1978
with
Macrotomoderus
Pic, 1901
.

Derarimus bidens Uhmann
was included in the key of
Uhmann ( 1994 a)
without mentioning any collection data, with its formal description appearing five years later (
Uhmann 1999
).
Derarimus bidens
Uhmann, 1994
a is an available name (Article 13.1.1), so
D . bidens
Uhmann, 1999
is here placed in synonymy. This species has been subsequently cited only by Telnov ( 2004 , as
D . bidens
Uhmann, 1999
).
Notes

Derarimus flavicornis Uhmann
was characterized in the key of
Uhmann ( 1994 a)
in the same manner as
D . bidens
(see above), but it was formally described two years later (
Uhmann 1996 a
).
Derarimus flavicornis
Uhmann, 1994
a is an available name (Article 13.1.1), so
D . flavicornis
Uhmann, 1996
a is here placed as its synonym.
Notes

Derarimus flavipubens
Uhmann, 1996
a is here placed in synonymy for the same reasons discussed under
Macrotomoderus flavicornis
. It was later cited only by
Telnov ( 1998 b
, as
D . flavipubens Uhmann, 1996
).
Notes

Derarimus foveicollis
Uhmann, 1996
a is synonymised for the same reasons listed under
Macrotomoderus flavicornis
. This species was later cited only twice (
Uhmann 1996 b
;
Telnov 1998 b
, in both cases as
D . foveicollis Uhmann, 1996
).

Macrotomoderus sandokan
nom. nov
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Derarimus minor
Uhmann, 1994 a
: 676
(not
Macrotomoderus minor
Pic, 1934 b
: 28
)
Derarimus minor
Uhmann, 1994 b
: 406
syn. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Notes

Derarimus minor Uhmann
was identified in a key, without mentioning any collection locality data, by
Uhmann ( 1994 a)
, but its formal description (
Uhmann 1994 b
) appears a bit later ([ 30 ] September and
27 th October
, respectively). The type locality is in Malaysia (
Uhmann 1994 b
).
Derarimus minor
Uhmann, 1994
a is an available name (Article 13.1.1), so
D . minor
Uhmann, 1994
b is here placed in synonymy.

Pic ( 1943 b)
described
Macrotomoderus minor
from Hoa Binh ( Vietnam ).
Telnov ( 2007 b)
synonymised
Derarimus
with
Macrotomoderus
, so
D . minor Uhmann
is a junior secondary homonym of Pic's species. The replacement name
Macrotomoderus sandokan
nom. nov. is here proposed for
D. minor
Uhmann, 1994
a and is named as a noun in apposition for Sandokan , "the tiger of Malaysia ", E. Salgari's hero who fought against the Dutch and British Empires.
Notes

Derarimus schillhammeri
Uhmann, 1996
a is here placed in synonymy for the same reasons listed under
Macrotomoderus flavicornis
. It was later cited only by Telnov ( 2004 , as
D . schillhammeri Uhmann, 1996
).
Notes

This synonymy is established for the same reasons mentioned under
Macrotomoderus flavicornis
.
Macrotomoderus schoedli
was later cited only by Telnov ( 2004 , as
D . schoedli Uhmann, 1996
).
Notes

Derarimus shuhi
Uhmann, 1994
b is here placed in synonymy for the same reasons listed under
Macrotomoderus sandokan
. This species was later cited only by Telnov ( 2004 , as
D . schuhi
Uhmann, 1994
b).
Notes

Derarimus sumatrensis
Uhmann, 1999
is here synonymized for the same reasons mentioned under
Macrotomoderus bidens
.
